library.title: Failed Login Attempts by User
library.description: Identify users with the most failed authentication attempts, useful for detecting brute force attacks or compromised accounts.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4625
| stats count as failed_attempts by user
| sort -failed_attempts
| head 20

library.title: Successful Logins After Multiple Failures
library.description: Detect accounts that successfully logged in after multiple failed attempts - potential indicator of successful brute force.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security (EventCode=4625 OR EventCode=4624)
| stats count(eval(EventCode=4625)) as failures, count(eval(EventCode=4624)) as successes by user
| where failures >= 5 AND successes >= 1
| sort -failures

library.title: Logins Outside Business Hours
library.description: Find authentication events occurring outside normal business hours (6 PM to 6 AM).
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4624
| eval hour=strftime(_time, "%H")
| where hour < 6 OR hour >= 18
| stats count by user, src_ip
| sort -count

library.title: Password Spray Detection
library.description: Detect password spray attacks by finding single source IPs attempting to authenticate against many accounts.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4625
| bin _time span=15m
| stats dc(user) as unique_users, count as attempts by src_ip, _time
| where unique_users > 10 AND attempts > 20
| sort -unique_users

library.title: Account Lockouts
library.description: Track account lockout events to identify potential attacks or misconfigured services.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4740
| stats count, values(src_ip) as source_ips by user
| sort -count

library.title: Interactive Logins to Servers
library.description: Monitor interactive (console) logins to servers which may indicate unauthorized access.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4624 Logon_Type=2
| stats count, earliest(_time) as first_login, latest(_time) as last_login by user, dest
| eval first_login=strftime(first_login, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| eval last_login=strftime(last_login, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort -count

library.title: RDP Logins from External IPs
library.description: Detect Remote Desktop connections originating from external (non-RFC1918) IP addresses.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4624 Logon_Type=10
| where NOT (cidrmatch("10.0.0.0/8", src_ip) OR cidrmatch("172.16.0.0/12", src_ip) OR cidrmatch("192.168.0.0/16", src_ip))
| stats count by user, src_ip, dest
| sort -count

library.title: Kerberos Ticket Anomalies
library.description: Detect Kerberos authentication anomalies that may indicate Golden/Silver ticket attacks.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4769
| eval ticket_options=tonumber(Ticket_Options, 16)
| where ticket_options=0x40810000 OR Failure_Code!="0x0"
| stats count by user, Service_Name, Client_Address, Failure_Code
| sort -count

library.title: Service Account Anomalous Logins
library.description: Detect service accounts logging in from unexpected locations or with interactive logon types.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4624
| search user="svc_*" OR user="service_*"
| where Logon_Type=2 OR Logon_Type=10
| stats count by user, src_ip, Logon_Type, dest
| sort -count

library.title: VPN Concurrent Sessions
library.description: Find users with concurrent VPN sessions from different locations.
library.spl:
index=vpn action=connected
| stats dc(src_ip) as unique_sources, values(src_ip) as source_ips by user
| where unique_sources > 1
| sort -unique_sources

library.title: Disabled Account Login Attempts
library.description: Detect attempts to authenticate with disabled accounts.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4625 Sub_Status="0xC0000072"
| stats count, values(src_ip) as source_ips by user
| sort -count

library.title: NTLM Authentication Usage
library.description: Monitor NTLM authentication which may indicate legacy systems or potential downgrade attacks.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4624 Authentication_Package=NTLM
| stats count by user, src_ip, dest, LmPackageName
| sort -count

library.title: Top Talkers by Bytes
library.description: Identify the source IPs transferring the most data across the network.
library.spl:
index=firewall
| stats sum(bytes_out) as total_bytes by src_ip
| eval total_mb=round(total_bytes/1024/1024, 2)
| sort -total_bytes
| head 20
| fields src_ip, total_mb

library.title: Connections to Known Bad IPs
library.description: Detect connections to IP addresses on threat intelligence lists.
library.spl:
index=firewall action=allowed
| lookup threat_intel_ip ip as dest_ip OUTPUT threat_type, threat_score
| where isnotnull(threat_type)
| stats count, values(threat_type) as threats by src_ip, dest_ip
| sort -count

library.title: Unusual Port Usage
library.description: Find connections using uncommon destination ports that may indicate C2 or tunneling.
library.spl:
index=firewall action=allowed dest_port!=80 dest_port!=443 dest_port!=53 dest_port!=22 dest_port!=25
| stats count, dc(src_ip) as unique_sources by dest_port
| where count > 100
| sort -count

library.title: DNS Query Volume Anomaly
library.description: Detect hosts making an unusually high number of DNS queries which may indicate DNS tunneling or malware.
library.spl:
index=dns
| stats count as query_count, dc(query) as unique_queries by src_ip
| where query_count > 1000
| eval ratio=round(query_count/unique_queries, 2)
| sort -query_count

library.title: Long DNS Query Names
library.description: Find DNS queries with unusually long domain names which may indicate DNS tunneling or DGA malware.
library.spl:
index=dns
| eval query_length=len(query)
| where query_length > 50
| stats count by query, src_ip
| sort -count

library.title: Beaconing Detection
library.description: Identify potential C2 beaconing by finding connections with regular intervals.
library.spl:
index=firewall action=allowed
| bin _time span=1m
| stats count by _time, src_ip, dest_ip
| streamstats current=f last(_time) as prev_time by src_ip, dest_ip
| eval interval=_time-prev_time
| stats stdev(interval) as interval_stdev, avg(interval) as avg_interval, count by src_ip, dest_ip
| where interval_stdev < 60 AND count > 50 AND avg_interval < 600
| sort interval_stdev

library.title: Outbound Connections to Rare Destinations
library.description: Find outbound connections to destinations that are rarely contacted by your organization.
library.spl:
index=firewall action=allowed direction=outbound
| stats dc(src_ip) as unique_sources, count as connections by dest_ip
| where unique_sources <= 2 AND connections > 10
| sort -connections

library.title: Port Scanning Detection
library.description: Detect potential port scanning by identifying sources hitting many different ports.
library.spl:
index=firewall
| bin _time span=5m
| stats dc(dest_port) as unique_ports, dc(dest_ip) as unique_hosts by src_ip, _time
| where unique_ports > 20
| stats sum(unique_ports) as total_ports, sum(unique_hosts) as total_hosts by src_ip
| sort -total_ports

library.title: Tor Exit Node Connections
library.description: Detect connections to or from known Tor exit nodes.
library.spl:
index=firewall
| lookup tor_exit_nodes ip as dest_ip OUTPUT is_tor
| where is_tor="true"
| stats count by src_ip, dest_ip, dest_port
| sort -count

library.title: SSL/TLS Certificate Anomalies
library.description: Find SSL connections with suspicious certificate characteristics.
library.spl:
index=zeek sourcetype=zeek_ssl
| where certificate_not_valid_before > _time OR certificate_not_valid_after < _time
| stats count by dest_ip, server_name, certificate_issuer
| sort -count

library.title: ICMP Tunneling Detection
library.description: Detect potential ICMP tunneling by finding unusually large or frequent ICMP traffic.
library.spl:
index=firewall protocol=icmp
| stats count, sum(bytes) as total_bytes, avg(bytes) as avg_bytes by src_ip, dest_ip
| where avg_bytes > 100 OR count > 1000
| sort -total_bytes

library.title: Geographic Connection Anomalies
library.description: Identify connections to unusual geographic locations based on your organization baseline.
library.spl:
index=firewall action=allowed direction=outbound
| iplocation dest_ip
| stats count, dc(src_ip) as unique_sources by Country
| where count > 10 AND Country!="United States"
| sort -count

library.title: New Process Execution
library.description: Identify newly executed processes that have not been seen before in your environment.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| stats earliest(_time) as first_seen, count by process_name, process_path
| where first_seen > relative_time(now(), "-24h")
| sort -first_seen
| eval first_seen=strftime(first_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")

library.title: PowerShell Encoded Commands
library.description: Detect PowerShell execution with encoded command line arguments often used by attackers.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1 process_name="powershell.exe"
| search CommandLine="*-enc*" OR CommandLine="*-encoded*" OR CommandLine="*-e *" OR CommandLine="*FromBase64*"
| stats count by user, CommandLine, ParentCommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Suspicious Parent-Child Process
library.description: Find unusual parent-child process relationships that may indicate exploitation.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| eval suspicious=case(
    parent_process_name="winword.exe" AND (process_name="cmd.exe" OR process_name="powershell.exe"), "Office spawning shell",
    parent_process_name="outlook.exe" AND process_name="powershell.exe", "Outlook spawning PowerShell",
    parent_process_name="excel.exe" AND process_name="mshta.exe", "Excel spawning MSHTA",
    true(), null())
| where isnotnull(suspicious)
| stats count by suspicious, parent_process_name, process_name, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: LOLBAS Execution
library.description: Detect execution of Living Off the Land Binaries, Scripts, and Libraries.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search process_name IN ("certutil.exe", "bitsadmin.exe", "mshta.exe", "regsvr32.exe", "rundll32.exe", "wmic.exe", "cmstp.exe", "msiexec.exe")
| stats count by process_name, CommandLine, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: File Downloads via CertUtil
library.description: Detect certutil.exe being used to download files, a common attacker technique.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1 process_name="certutil.exe"
| search CommandLine="*urlcache*" OR CommandLine="*split*" OR CommandLine="*-decode*"
| stats count by host, user, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Credential Dumping Indicators
library.description: Detect potential credential dumping through LSASS access or common tools.
library.spl:
index=sysmon (EventCode=10 TargetImage="*lsass.exe") OR (EventCode=1 (process_name="procdump.exe" OR process_name="mimikatz.exe" OR CommandLine="*sekurlsa*"))
| stats count by EventCode, process_name, SourceImage, TargetImage, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Registry Run Key Modification
library.description: Detect modifications to registry Run keys used for persistence.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=13
| search TargetObject="*\Run\*" OR TargetObject="*\RunOnce\*"
| stats count by host, user, process_name, TargetObject, Details
| sort -count

library.title: DLL Side-Loading Detection
library.description: Identify potential DLL side-loading by finding DLLs loaded from unusual locations.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=7
| where NOT match(ImageLoaded, "^(C:\\Windows|C:\\Program Files)")
| stats count by process_name, ImageLoaded, host
| sort -count

library.title: Scheduled Task Creation
library.description: Monitor creation of scheduled tasks which can be used for persistence.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4698
| stats count by user, TaskName, host
| sort -count

library.title: Service Installation
library.description: Track new service installations which may indicate persistence or privilege escalation.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=4697
| stats count by user, ServiceName, ServiceFileName, host
| sort -count

library.title: Unsigned Binaries Execution
library.description: Find execution of unsigned binaries which may indicate malware or unauthorized software.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1 Signature="*unsigned*" OR SignatureStatus!="Valid"
| stats count by process_name, process_path, SignatureStatus, host
| sort -count

library.title: Process Injection Indicators
library.description: Detect potential process injection through CreateRemoteThread calls.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=8
| where SourceImage!=TargetImage
| stats count by SourceImage, TargetImage, host
| sort -count

library.title: Executable in Temp Folder
library.description: Detect execution of files from temporary directories, common for malware droppers.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search process_path="*\Temp\*" OR process_path="*\tmp\*" OR process_path="*\AppData\Local\Temp\*"
| stats count by process_name, process_path, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Double Extension Files
library.description: Find files with double extensions commonly used to trick users (e.g., invoice.pdf.exe).
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| rex field=TargetFilename "(?<filename>[^\\]+)$"
| where match(filename, "\.(doc|pdf|jpg|png|txt)\.(exe|scr|bat|cmd|vbs|js)$")
| stats count by filename, TargetFilename, host
| sort -count

library.title: Known Malware Hashes
library.description: Check process hashes against known malware hash lists.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| lookup malware_hashes hash as Hashes OUTPUT malware_name, malware_family
| where isnotnull(malware_name)
| stats count by malware_name, malware_family, process_name, host
| sort -count

library.title: WMI Execution
library.description: Monitor WMI command execution which can be used for lateral movement and persistence.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1 (parent_process_name="wmiprvse.exe" OR process_name="wmic.exe")
| stats count by process_name, CommandLine, parent_process_name, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Macro-Enabled Document Access
library.description: Track access to macro-enabled Office documents which are common malware vectors.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| search TargetFilename="*.xlsm" OR TargetFilename="*.docm" OR TargetFilename="*.pptm"
| stats count by TargetFilename, process_name, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Suspicious Script Downloads
library.description: Detect downloads of potentially malicious script files.
library.spl:
index=proxy OR index=firewall
| search url="*.ps1" OR url="*.vbs" OR url="*.js" OR url="*.hta" OR url="*.bat"
| stats count by src_ip, url, dest_ip
| sort -count

library.title: Ransomware File Extension Changes
library.description: Detect mass file renaming with known ransomware extensions.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| rex field=TargetFilename "\.(?<extension>[^\\.]+)$"
| search extension IN ("encrypted", "locked", "crypto", "crypt", "enc", "locky", "cerber", "wannacry")
| stats count by host, extension
| where count > 10
| sort -count

library.title: Shadow Copy Deletion
library.description: Detect deletion of shadow copies, a common ransomware precursor.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search CommandLine="*vssadmin*delete*" OR CommandLine="*wmic*shadowcopy*delete*"
| stats count by host, user, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Base64 in Command Line
library.description: Find processes with Base64-encoded strings in command lines, often used to obfuscate malicious commands.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| rex field=CommandLine "(?<b64_string>[A-Za-z0-9+/=]{50,})"
| where isnotnull(b64_string)
| stats count by process_name, b64_string, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Cobalt Strike Indicators
library.description: Detect potential Cobalt Strike beacons through common behavioral indicators.
library.spl:
index=sysmon (EventCode=1 CommandLine="*rundll32.exe*,StartW*") OR
(EventCode=3 dest_port IN (80, 443, 8080) Image="*rundll32.exe*") OR
(EventCode=1 parent_process_name="rundll32.exe" process_name IN ("cmd.exe", "powershell.exe"))
| stats count by EventCode, process_name, CommandLine, dest_ip, host
| sort -count

library.title: Large Outbound Data Transfers
library.description: Identify unusually large outbound data transfers that may indicate exfiltration.
library.spl:
index=firewall direction=outbound
| stats sum(bytes_out) as total_bytes by src_ip, dest_ip
| eval total_mb=round(total_bytes/1024/1024, 2)
| where total_mb > 100
| sort -total_mb

library.title: Cloud Storage Uploads
library.description: Track uploads to cloud storage services that may be used for data exfiltration.
library.spl:
index=proxy
| search url="*dropbox.com*" OR url="*drive.google.com*" OR url="*onedrive.live.com*" OR url="*box.com*"
| where http_method="POST" OR http_method="PUT"
| stats sum(bytes_out) as uploaded_bytes, count by src_ip, user, url
| sort -uploaded_bytes

library.title: USB Device Usage
library.description: Monitor USB storage device connections for potential data theft.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=6 OR index=security EventCode=6416
| stats count, earliest(_time) as first_seen, latest(_time) as last_seen by DeviceDescription, host, user
| eval first_seen=strftime(first_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| eval last_seen=strftime(last_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort -count

library.title: Email with Large Attachments
library.description: Find emails with unusually large attachments being sent externally.
library.spl:
index=email direction=outbound
| where attachment_size > 10000000
| stats sum(attachment_size) as total_size, values(attachment_name) as attachments by sender, recipient
| eval total_mb=round(total_size/1024/1024, 2)
| sort -total_mb

library.title: After-Hours Data Access
library.description: Detect file access to sensitive directories outside business hours.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| eval hour=strftime(_time, "%H")
| where (hour < 6 OR hour >= 20) AND (TargetFilename="*Finance*" OR TargetFilename="*HR*" OR TargetFilename="*Confidential*")
| stats count by user, TargetFilename, host
| sort -count

library.title: Bulk File Access
library.description: Identify users accessing an unusually high number of files in a short period.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| bin _time span=1h
| stats dc(TargetFilename) as unique_files, count by user, host, _time
| where unique_files > 100
| sort -unique_files

library.title: FTP/SFTP Transfers
library.description: Monitor FTP and SFTP file transfers for potential data exfiltration.
library.spl:
index=firewall dest_port IN (20, 21, 22, 990) action=allowed
| stats sum(bytes_out) as total_bytes, count by src_ip, dest_ip, dest_port
| eval total_mb=round(total_bytes/1024/1024, 2)
| sort -total_mb

library.title: Print Job Monitoring
library.description: Track print jobs that may indicate document exfiltration via printing.
library.spl:
index=windows sourcetype=WinEventLog:PrintService EventCode=307
| stats count, sum(Pages) as total_pages by user, DocumentName, PrinterName
| where total_pages > 50
| sort -total_pages

library.title: First Time Access to Resource
library.description: Detect when users access resources for the first time.
library.spl:
index=security sourcetype=WinEventLog:Security EventCode=5140
| stats earliest(_time) as first_access by user, ShareName
| where first_access > relative_time(now(), "-24h")
| eval first_access=strftime(first_access, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort -first_access

library.title: User Account Activity Spike
library.description: Find users with sudden increase in activity compared to their baseline.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4624
| bin _time span=1d
| stats count as daily_logins by user, _time
| streamstats avg(daily_logins) as baseline, stdev(daily_logins) as stdev_logins by user
| eval zscore=(daily_logins-baseline)/stdev_logins
| where zscore > 3
| sort -zscore

library.title: Multiple Concurrent Sessions
library.description: Identify users with multiple active sessions from different sources.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4624 Logon_Type IN (2, 3, 10)
| stats dc(src_ip) as unique_sources, values(src_ip) as sources by user
| where unique_sources > 2
| sort -unique_sources

library.title: Dormant Account Reactivation
library.description: Detect when accounts that have been inactive for 30+ days become active.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4624
| stats latest(_time) as last_login, earliest(_time) as first_login by user
| eval days_inactive=round((last_login-first_login)/86400, 0)
| where days_inactive > 30 AND last_login > relative_time(now(), "-24h")
| eval last_login=strftime(last_login, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort -days_inactive

library.title: Admin Tool Usage by Non-Admins
library.description: Detect non-admin users running administrative tools.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search process_name IN ("net.exe", "net1.exe", "dsquery.exe", "nltest.exe", "whoami.exe", "gpresult.exe")
| lookup admin_users user OUTPUT is_admin
| where is_admin!="true"
| stats count by user, process_name, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: Unusual Application Usage
library.description: Find users running applications they have never used before.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| stats earliest(_time) as first_use, count by user, process_name
| where first_use > relative_time(now(), "-24h")
| stats count as new_apps, values(process_name) as applications by user
| where new_apps > 5
| sort -new_apps

library.title: High-Risk User Activity
library.description: Correlate multiple risk indicators for users who may be compromised.
library.spl:
index=security OR index=sysmon
| eval risk_score=case(
    EventCode=4625, 1,
    EventCode=4720, 5,
    EventCode=4728, 5,
    process_name="mimikatz.exe", 10,
    match(CommandLine, ".*encoded.*"), 3,
    true(), 0)
| stats sum(risk_score) as total_risk by user
| where total_risk > 10
| sort -total_risk

library.title: Workstation Hopping
library.description: Detect users logging into an unusual number of workstations.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4624 Logon_Type=3
| bin _time span=1d
| stats dc(dest) as unique_hosts, values(dest) as hosts by user, _time
| where unique_hosts > 10
| sort -unique_hosts

library.title: Session Duration Anomalies
library.description: Find sessions that are unusually long or short compared to typical patterns.
library.spl:
index=security (EventCode=4624 OR EventCode=4634) Logon_Type=3
| transaction user startswith=EventCode=4624 endswith=EventCode=4634
| eval duration_hours=duration/3600
| stats avg(duration_hours) as avg_duration, stdev(duration_hours) as stdev_duration by user
| where stdev_duration > 2
| sort -stdev_duration

library.title: Failed Resource Access Patterns
library.description: Identify users repeatedly failing to access resources they do not have permission for.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=5145 Status="0xC0000022"
| stats count, dc(ShareName) as unique_shares by user
| where count > 10
| sort -count

library.title: User Added to Admin Group
library.description: Detect when users are added to privileged groups like Domain Admins.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4728 OR EventCode=4732 OR EventCode=4756
| search TargetUserName="*admin*" OR TargetUserName="Domain Admins" OR TargetUserName="Enterprise Admins"
| stats count by MemberName, TargetUserName, SubjectUserName
| sort -count

library.title: Privilege Escalation via Token
library.description: Detect processes acquiring sensitive privileges that may indicate privilege escalation.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4672
| search PrivilegeList="*SeDebugPrivilege*" OR PrivilegeList="*SeTcbPrivilege*"
| stats count by SubjectUserName, ProcessName, PrivilegeList
| sort -count

library.title: UAC Bypass Attempts
library.description: Detect potential UAC bypass techniques through suspicious process chains.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (parent_process_name="eventvwr.exe" AND process_name!="mmc.exe") OR
         (parent_process_name="fodhelper.exe" AND process_name!="fodhelper.exe") OR
         (parent_process_name="computerdefaults.exe")
| stats count by parent_process_name, process_name, CommandLine, user
| sort -count

library.title: Sudo Abuse (Linux)
library.description: Detect suspicious sudo usage or attempts to escalate privileges on Linux systems.
library.spl:
index=linux sourcetype=linux_secure
| search "sudo:" AND ("FAILED" OR "NOT in sudoers" OR "incorrect password")
| stats count by user, host, command
| sort -count

library.title: Pass-the-Hash Detection
library.description: Detect potential Pass-the-Hash attacks through NTLM authentication anomalies.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4624 Logon_Type=3 Authentication_Package=NTLM
| where user!=src_user AND isnotnull(src_user)
| stats count by user, src_user, src_ip, dest
| sort -count

library.title: Password Reset by Non-Help Desk
library.description: Detect password resets performed by users outside the help desk team.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4724
| lookup helpdesk_users user as SubjectUserName OUTPUT is_helpdesk
| where is_helpdesk!="true"
| stats count by SubjectUserName, TargetUserName
| sort -count

library.title: Service Account Privilege Use
library.description: Monitor when service accounts use interactive or elevated privileges.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4672
| search SubjectUserName="svc_*" OR SubjectUserName="service_*"
| where NOT match(ProcessName, "(?i)(services|svchost|system)")
| stats count by SubjectUserName, ProcessName, PrivilegeList
| sort -count

library.title: RunAs Execution
library.description: Track usage of RunAs to execute processes with different credentials.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1 process_name="runas.exe"
| stats count by user, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: New Startup Items
library.description: Detect new items added to Windows startup locations.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| search TargetFilename="*\Startup\*" OR TargetFilename="*\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\*"
| stats count by TargetFilename, process_name, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: WMI Event Subscription
library.description: Detect WMI event subscriptions used for persistence.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=19 OR EventCode=20 OR EventCode=21
| stats count by EventType, Operation, User, Consumer, host
| sort -count

library.title: Cron Job Modifications (Linux)
library.description: Monitor changes to cron jobs which can be used for persistence.
library.spl:
index=linux (source="/var/log/cron" OR source="/var/log/syslog")
| search "EDIT" OR "REPLACE" OR "crontab"
| stats count by user, host, _raw
| sort -count

library.title: Browser Extension Installation
library.description: Detect installation of browser extensions which can be used for persistence or data theft.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| search TargetFilename="*\Extensions\*" OR TargetFilename="*\chrome\*extension*"
| stats count by TargetFilename, process_name, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: New GPO Creation
library.description: Monitor creation of new Group Policy Objects which can be used for persistence.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=5136 AttributeLDAPDisplayName="gPLink"
| stats count by SubjectUserName, ObjectDN, AttributeValue
| sort -count

library.title: Boot Record Modification
library.description: Detect potential bootkit installation through MBR/VBR modifications.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search process_path="*\System32\*" AND (CommandLine="*mbr*" OR CommandLine="*vbr*" OR CommandLine="*boot*sector*")
| stats count by process_name, CommandLine, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: SSH Authorized Keys Modification
library.description: Monitor modifications to SSH authorized_keys files for unauthorized access.
library.spl:
index=linux source="/var/log/audit/audit.log"
| search name="authorized_keys"
| stats count by user, host, key
| sort -count

library.title: DLL Search Order Hijacking
library.description: Detect potential DLL hijacking by monitoring DLL loads from writable locations.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=7
| where NOT match(ImageLoaded, "^C:\\Windows\\") AND NOT match(ImageLoaded, "^C:\\Program Files")
| eval loaded_path=replace(ImageLoaded, "[^\\]+$", "")
| eval process_path=replace(Image, "[^\\]+$", "")
| where loaded_path!=process_path
| stats count by process_name, ImageLoaded, host
| sort -count

library.title: Active Directory Enumeration
library.description: Detect AD enumeration through LDAP queries or enumeration tools.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4662
| search ObjectType="*user*" OR ObjectType="*group*" OR ObjectType="*computer*"
| stats count by SubjectUserName, ObjectName, ObjectType
| where count > 100
| sort -count

library.title: Network Share Enumeration
library.description: Detect enumeration of network shares which may precede lateral movement.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search CommandLine="*net view*" OR CommandLine="*net share*" OR CommandLine="*Get-SmbShare*"
| stats count by user, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: System Information Gathering
library.description: Detect commands used to gather system information.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search CommandLine="*systeminfo*" OR CommandLine="*hostname*" OR CommandLine="*whoami*" OR CommandLine="*ipconfig*"
| stats count by user, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: User and Group Enumeration
library.description: Detect enumeration of user accounts and group memberships.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search CommandLine="*net user*" OR CommandLine="*net group*" OR CommandLine="*net localgroup*" OR CommandLine="*Get-ADUser*"
| stats count by user, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: Port Scanning from Internal Host
library.description: Detect internal hosts performing port scanning activities.
library.spl:
index=firewall action=blocked
| bin _time span=5m
| stats dc(dest_port) as unique_ports, dc(dest_ip) as unique_hosts by src_ip, _time
| where unique_ports > 50 OR unique_hosts > 20
| sort -unique_ports

library.title: BloodHound/SharpHound Detection
library.description: Detect usage of BloodHound/SharpHound for AD reconnaissance.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search CommandLine="*SharpHound*" OR CommandLine="*Invoke-Bloodhound*" OR CommandLine="*-CollectionMethod*"
| stats count by user, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: DNS Zone Transfer Attempts
library.description: Detect attempts to perform DNS zone transfers.
library.spl:
index=dns query_type=AXFR OR query_type=IXFR
| stats count by src_ip, query
| sort -count

library.title: SNMP Enumeration
library.description: Detect SNMP enumeration attempts against network devices.
library.spl:
index=firewall dest_port=161
| stats count, dc(dest_ip) as unique_targets by src_ip
| where unique_targets > 5
| sort -unique_targets

library.title: AWS Root Account Login
library.description: Detect logins using the AWS root account which should be avoided.
library.spl:
index=aws sourcetype=aws:cloudtrail eventName=ConsoleLogin userIdentity.type=Root
| stats count by sourceIPAddress, eventTime, userAgent
| sort -count

library.title: AWS Security Group Changes
library.description: Monitor changes to AWS security groups that control network access.
library.spl:
index=aws sourcetype=aws:cloudtrail eventName IN ("AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress", "AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress", "RevokeSecurityGroupIngress", "CreateSecurityGroup")
| stats count by userIdentity.userName, eventName, requestParameters.groupId
| sort -count

library.title: AWS IAM Policy Changes
library.description: Track changes to IAM policies which control permissions.
library.spl:
index=aws sourcetype=aws:cloudtrail eventName IN ("PutUserPolicy", "PutRolePolicy", "AttachUserPolicy", "AttachRolePolicy", "CreatePolicy")
| stats count by userIdentity.userName, eventName, requestParameters.policyName
| sort -count

library.title: AWS S3 Public Access
library.description: Detect S3 buckets being made publicly accessible.
library.spl:
index=aws sourcetype=aws:cloudtrail eventName IN ("PutBucketAcl", "PutBucketPolicy")
| search requestParameters.accessControlPolicy.grants{}.grantee.uri="*AllUsers*" OR requestParameters.accessControlPolicy.grants{}.grantee.uri="*AuthenticatedUsers*"
| stats count by userIdentity.userName, requestParameters.bucketName
| sort -count

library.title: Azure Sign-in from New Location
library.description: Detect Azure AD sign-ins from new geographic locations.
library.spl:
index=azure sourcetype=azure:aad:signin
| stats earliest(_time) as first_seen by userPrincipalName, location.city, location.countryOrRegion
| where first_seen > relative_time(now(), "-24h")
| eval first_seen=strftime(first_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort -first_seen

library.title: Azure Privileged Role Assignment
library.description: Monitor assignment of privileged Azure AD roles.
library.spl:
index=azure sourcetype=azure:aad:audit operationName="Add member to role"
| search targetResources{}.modifiedProperties{}.displayName="Role.DisplayName" targetResources{}.modifiedProperties{}.newValue="*Admin*"
| stats count by initiatedBy.user.userPrincipalName, targetResources{}.userPrincipalName
| sort -count

library.title: GCP Service Account Key Creation
library.description: Track creation of service account keys which can be misused.
library.spl:
index=gcp sourcetype=google:gcp:pubsub:message methodName="google.iam.admin.v1.CreateServiceAccountKey"
| stats count by protoPayload.authenticationInfo.principalEmail, protoPayload.resourceName
| sort -count

library.title: Cloud API Errors Spike
library.description: Detect sudden increases in cloud API errors which may indicate attack attempts.
library.spl:
index=aws sourcetype=aws:cloudtrail errorCode!=""
| timechart span=1h count by errorCode
| foreach * [eval <<FIELD>>=if(<<FIELD>>>100, <<FIELD>>, null())]
| where isnotnull(AccessDenied) OR isnotnull(UnauthorizedAccess)

library.title: Audit Policy Changes
library.description: Track changes to Windows audit policies which may indicate an attacker covering tracks.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4719
| stats count by SubjectUserName, CategoryId, SubcategoryGuid, AuditPolicyChanges
| sort -count

library.title: Log Clearing Events
library.description: Detect when security logs are cleared which may indicate evidence destruction.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=1102 OR EventCode=104
| stats count by SubjectUserName, Channel, host
| sort -count

library.title: User Account Changes Summary
library.description: Comprehensive view of user account modifications for compliance reporting.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode IN (4720, 4722, 4723, 4724, 4725, 4726, 4738)
| eval action=case(
    EventCode=4720, "Created",
    EventCode=4722, "Enabled",
    EventCode=4723, "Password Changed (by user)",
    EventCode=4724, "Password Reset",
    EventCode=4725, "Disabled",
    EventCode=4726, "Deleted",
    EventCode=4738, "Changed")
| stats count by action, SubjectUserName, TargetUserName
| sort action

library.title: Failed Access to Sensitive Data
library.description: Track failed attempts to access files in sensitive directories.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4656 Keywords="Audit Failure"
| search ObjectName="*Finance*" OR ObjectName="*HR*" OR ObjectName="*Legal*" OR ObjectName="*Confidential*"
| stats count by SubjectUserName, ObjectName, ProcessName
| sort -count

library.title: Splunk Indexing Lag
library.description: Monitor the delay between event time and index time to detect ingestion issues.
library.spl:
index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd component=Metrics group=queue
| eval lag=indexing_lag
| timechart span=5m avg(lag) as avg_lag_seconds
| where avg_lag_seconds > 60

library.title: Data Source Volume Monitoring
library.description: Track event volume by sourcetype to identify unexpected drops or spikes.
library.spl:
| tstats count where index=* by index, sourcetype, _time span=1h
| timechart span=1h sum(count) by sourcetype

library.title: Silent Log Sources
library.description: Find hosts that have stopped sending logs in the last 24 hours.
library.spl:
| tstats latest(_time) as last_seen where index=* by host
| eval hours_ago=round((now()-last_seen)/3600, 1)
| where hours_ago > 24
| sort -hours_ago
| eval last_seen=strftime(last_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")

library.title: Search Performance Issues
library.description: Identify slow-running searches that may impact system performance.
library.spl:
index=_audit action=search info=completed
| eval runtime_mins=total_run_time/60
| where runtime_mins > 5
| stats count, avg(runtime_mins) as avg_runtime by user, search
| sort -avg_runtime

library.title: Forwarder Health Check
library.description: Monitor Universal Forwarder connectivity and data transmission status.
library.spl:
index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd component=Metrics group=tcpin_connections
| stats latest(connectionType) as type, latest(fwdType) as forwarder_type, latest(version) as version by hostname
| join type=left hostname [| tstats latest(_time) as last_event where index=* by host | rename host as hostname]
| eval status=if(now()-last_event>3600, "STALE", "OK")
| table hostname, type, forwarder_type, version, status

library.title: License Usage Tracking
library.description: Monitor daily license usage to prevent overages and plan capacity.
library.spl:
index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd component=LicenseUsage type=Usage
| timechart span=1d sum(b) as bytes_indexed
| eval gb_indexed=round(bytes_indexed/1024/1024/1024, 2)
| fields _time, gb_indexed

library.title: Queue Fill Ratio
library.description: Monitor Splunk internal queues to detect processing bottlenecks.
library.spl:
index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd component=Metrics group=queue
| eval fill_ratio=current_size_kb/max_size_kb*100
| where fill_ratio > 70
| stats avg(fill_ratio) as avg_fill by name, host
| sort -avg_fill

library.title: Event Parsing Errors
library.description: Identify data sources with parsing or timestamp extraction issues.
library.spl:
index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd component=DateParserVerbose
| stats count by sourcetype, punct
| where count > 100
| sort -count

library.title: PsExec Remote Execution
library.description: Detect PsExec usage for remote command execution, commonly used for lateral movement.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (process_name="psexec.exe" OR process_name="psexesvc.exe" OR CommandLine="*\\\\*" process_name="cmd.exe")
| stats count by user, src_ip, dest, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: WMI Remote Process Creation
library.description: Detect remote process creation via WMI, a common lateral movement technique.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1 parent_process_name="wmiprvse.exe"
| search process_name!="wmiprvse.exe"
| stats count by host, user, process_name, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Remote Service Installation
library.description: Detect services being installed on remote systems for lateral movement.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4697
| where src_ip!=dest_ip OR isnotnull(src_ip)
| stats count by SubjectUserName, ServiceName, ServiceFileName, dest
| sort -count

library.title: SMB File Share Access Anomaly
library.description: Detect unusual patterns of SMB share access that may indicate lateral movement.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=5140
| bin _time span=1h
| stats dc(ShareName) as unique_shares, dc(dest) as unique_hosts, values(ShareName) as shares by src_ip, _time
| where unique_shares > 5 OR unique_hosts > 3
| sort -unique_shares

library.title: Remote Desktop Hopping
library.description: Detect RDP sessions chaining through multiple hosts (pivoting).
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4624 Logon_Type=10
| transaction user maxspan=4h
| where eventcount > 2
| stats values(src_ip) as hop_chain, dc(dest) as hosts_accessed by user
| where hosts_accessed > 2

library.title: Windows Admin Share Access
library.description: Monitor access to administrative shares (C$, ADMIN$) used in lateral movement.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=5140
| search ShareName="*$"
| stats count, dc(dest) as unique_targets by src_ip, SubjectUserName, ShareName
| sort -unique_targets

library.title: SSH Lateral Movement (Linux)
library.description: Track SSH connections between internal hosts that may indicate lateral movement.
library.spl:
index=linux sourcetype=linux_secure "Accepted"
| where cidrmatch("10.0.0.0/8", src_ip) OR cidrmatch("192.168.0.0/16", src_ip)
| stats count, dc(dest) as unique_targets by src_ip, user
| where unique_targets > 3
| sort -unique_targets

library.title: Remote Scheduled Task Creation
library.description: Detect scheduled tasks created on remote systems for lateral movement or persistence.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4698
| search TaskName!="*Microsoft*" TaskName!="*Windows*"
| where src_ip!=dest OR isnotnull(src_ip)
| stats count by SubjectUserName, TaskName, dest
| sort -count

library.title: Phishing Email Indicators
library.description: Detect emails with common phishing characteristics like suspicious attachments or links.
library.spl:
index=email
| search (attachment_name="*.exe" OR attachment_name="*.js" OR attachment_name="*.vbs" OR attachment_name="*.scr" OR body="*click here*" OR body="*verify your account*")
| stats count by sender, subject, attachment_name
| sort -count

library.title: External Sender Spoofing Internal Domain
library.description: Detect emails from external sources claiming to be from your internal domain.
library.spl:
index=email
| where like(sender, "%@yourdomain.com") AND NOT cidrmatch("10.0.0.0/8", src_ip)
| stats count by sender, src_ip, subject
| sort -count

library.title: Business Email Compromise Patterns
library.description: Detect emails with BEC indicators like wire transfer requests or urgency keywords.
library.spl:
index=email
| search (subject="*wire*" OR subject="*transfer*" OR subject="*urgent*" OR subject="*payment*" OR body="*bank account*" OR body="*routing number*")
| stats count by sender, recipient, subject
| sort -count

library.title: Email Forwarding Rules
library.description: Detect creation of email forwarding rules that may be used for data exfiltration.
library.spl:
index=o365 OR index=exchange Operation="New-InboxRule" OR Operation="Set-InboxRule"
| search Parameters="*ForwardTo*" OR Parameters="*RedirectTo*"
| stats count by UserId, Parameters
| sort -count

library.title: Mass Email Deletion
library.description: Detect bulk email deletions that may indicate evidence destruction or compromise.
library.spl:
index=o365 OR index=exchange Operation="HardDelete" OR Operation="SoftDelete"
| bin _time span=1h
| stats count by UserId, _time
| where count > 100
| sort -count

library.title: Emails with Password-Protected Attachments
library.description: Identify emails with encrypted attachments often used to bypass security scanning.
library.spl:
index=email
| search attachment_name="*.zip" OR attachment_name="*.7z" OR attachment_name="*.rar"
| where isnotnull(attachment_password) OR body="*password*"
| stats count by sender, recipient, attachment_name
| sort -count

library.title: Newly Registered Domain in Email
library.description: Detect emails from recently registered domains commonly used in phishing campaigns.
library.spl:
index=email
| rex field=sender "@(?<sender_domain>[^>]+)"
| lookup whois_data domain as sender_domain OUTPUT creation_date
| eval domain_age_days=(now()-strptime(creation_date, "%Y-%m-%d"))/86400
| where domain_age_days < 30
| stats count by sender_domain, domain_age_days
| sort domain_age_days

library.title: Email Authentication Failures
library.description: Monitor SPF, DKIM, and DMARC failures that may indicate spoofing attempts.
library.spl:
index=email
| search spf_result="fail" OR dkim_result="fail" OR dmarc_result="fail"
| stats count by sender_domain, spf_result, dkim_result, dmarc_result
| sort -count

library.title: SQL Injection Attempts
library.description: Detect potential SQL injection attacks in web application logs.
library.spl:
index=web OR index=waf
| search uri="*'*" OR uri="*--*" OR uri="*;*" OR uri="*UNION*" OR uri="*SELECT*" OR uri="*DROP*"
| rex field=uri "(?<sqli_pattern>('|--|;|UNION|SELECT|DROP|INSERT|UPDATE|DELETE))"
| stats count by src_ip, uri, sqli_pattern
| sort -count

library.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) Attempts
library.description: Detect potential XSS attacks in web requests.
library.spl:
index=web OR index=waf
| search uri="*<script*" OR uri="*javascript:*" OR uri="*onerror=*" OR uri="*onload=*"
| stats count by src_ip, uri
| sort -count

library.title: Directory Traversal Attempts
library.description: Detect attempts to access files outside the web root using path traversal.
library.spl:
index=web OR index=waf
| search uri="*../*" OR uri="*..\\*" OR uri="*/etc/passwd*" OR uri="*boot.ini*"
| stats count by src_ip, uri
| sort -count

library.title: Web Application Scanning
library.description: Detect automated vulnerability scanning against web applications.
library.spl:
index=web
| bin _time span=5m
| stats dc(uri) as unique_uris, count as requests by src_ip, _time
| where unique_uris > 100 AND requests > 500
| sort -unique_uris

library.title: Suspicious User Agents
library.description: Identify requests from known malicious or scanning tool user agents.
library.spl:
index=web
| search user_agent="*sqlmap*" OR user_agent="*nikto*" OR user_agent="*nmap*" OR user_agent="*curl*" OR user_agent="*wget*" OR user_agent="*python*"
| stats count by src_ip, user_agent
| sort -count

library.title: HTTP 4xx/5xx Error Spike
library.description: Detect unusual increases in web application errors that may indicate attacks.
library.spl:
index=web status>=400
| timechart span=5m count by status
| where '404' > 100 OR '403' > 50 OR '500' > 20

library.title: Web Shell Detection
library.description: Detect potential web shell activity through suspicious URI patterns and parameters.
library.spl:
index=web
| search (uri="*.php?cmd=*" OR uri="*.asp?exec=*" OR uri="*.jsp?c=*" OR uri="*shell*" OR uri="*eval(*" OR uri="*base64_decode*")
| stats count by src_ip, uri, dest
| sort -count

library.title: Brute Force Login Attempts
library.description: Detect brute force attacks against web application login pages.
library.spl:
index=web (uri="*login*" OR uri="*signin*" OR uri="*auth*") method=POST status=401
| bin _time span=5m
| stats count by src_ip, _time
| where count > 20
| sort -count

library.title: User Activity Timeline
library.description: Build a comprehensive timeline of all activity for a specific user during an incident.
library.spl:
index=* user="YOURUSER"
| eval event_type=case(
    sourcetype="WinEventLog:Security", "Windows Security",
    sourcetype="sysmon", "Sysmon",
    sourcetype="web", "Web Access",
    true(), sourcetype)
| table _time, event_type, sourcetype, action, src_ip, dest, process_name, CommandLine, _raw
| sort _time

library.title: Host Activity Timeline
library.description: Create a timeline of all security-relevant events on a compromised host.
library.spl:
index=* (host="YOURHOST" OR dest="YOURHOST" OR src="YOURHOST")
| eval event_summary=coalesce(signature, EventCode, action, process_name)
| table _time, sourcetype, event_summary, user, src_ip, dest_ip, process_name, CommandLine
| sort _time

library.title: First Occurrence of IOC
library.description: Find the first time a specific indicator of compromise appeared in your environment.
library.spl:
index=* ("MALICIOUS_IP" OR "MALICIOUS_DOMAIN" OR "MALICIOUS_HASH")
| stats earliest(_time) as first_seen, latest(_time) as last_seen, count by sourcetype, host
| eval first_seen=strftime(first_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| eval last_seen=strftime(last_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort first_seen

library.title: Affected Systems by IOC
library.description: Identify all systems that communicated with or executed a malicious indicator.
library.spl:
index=* ("MALICIOUS_IP" OR "MALICIOUS_DOMAIN" OR "MALICIOUS_HASH")
| stats count, earliest(_time) as first_contact, latest(_time) as last_contact by host
| eval first_contact=strftime(first_contact, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort first_contact

library.title: Process Execution Chain
library.description: Trace the parent-child process chain to understand attack execution flow.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1 host="YOURHOST"
| eval process_chain=ParentImage." -> ".Image
| stats values(CommandLine) as commands by process_chain, user
| sort process_chain

library.title: Lateral Movement Path
library.description: Map the path an attacker took moving between systems.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4624 Logon_Type IN (3, 10) user="COMPROMISED_USER"
| sort _time
| streamstats current=f last(dest) as previous_host by user
| where isnotnull(previous_host)
| eval hop=previous_host." -> ".dest
| stats earliest(_time) as time, values(src_ip) as src by hop
| sort time

library.title: Data Access During Incident
library.description: Identify what files and data a compromised account accessed during the incident window.
library.spl:
index=security (EventCode=4663 OR EventCode=5145) user="COMPROMISED_USER" earliest="INCIDENT_START" latest="INCIDENT_END"
| stats count, values(AccessMask) as access_types by ObjectName, ShareName
| sort -count

library.title: Network Connections During Incident
library.description: Map all network connections made by a compromised host during an incident.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=3 host="COMPROMISED_HOST" earliest="INCIDENT_START" latest="INCIDENT_END"
| stats count, values(DestinationPort) as ports by DestinationIp, Image
| iplocation DestinationIp
| sort -count

library.title: Privileged Command Execution
library.description: Track execution of privileged commands for compliance auditing.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search user IN ("Administrator", "SYSTEM", "root") OR CommandLine="*sudo*"
| stats count by user, process_name, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: System Time Changes
library.description: Detect system time modifications that could indicate anti-forensics.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4616
| stats count by SubjectUserName, PreviousTime, NewTime, host
| sort -count

library.title: Security Software Status
library.description: Monitor for disabled or stopped security software.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search CommandLine="*Stop-Service*" OR CommandLine="*net stop*" OR CommandLine="*taskkill*"
| search CommandLine="*defender*" OR CommandLine="*antivirus*" OR CommandLine="*security*" OR CommandLine="*firewall*"
| stats count by user, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: Administrative Actions Summary
library.description: Daily summary of all administrative actions for compliance reporting.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode IN (4720, 4722, 4725, 4726, 4728, 4732, 4756, 4697, 4698, 4719)
| eval action=case(
    EventCode=4720, "User Created",
    EventCode=4722, "User Enabled",
    EventCode=4725, "User Disabled",
    EventCode=4726, "User Deleted",
    EventCode=4728, "Added to Global Group",
    EventCode=4732, "Added to Local Group",
    EventCode=4756, "Added to Universal Group",
    EventCode=4697, "Service Installed",
    EventCode=4698, "Scheduled Task Created",
    EventCode=4719, "Audit Policy Changed")
| stats count by action, SubjectUserName
| sort action

library.title: Timestomping Detection
library.description: Detect file timestamp manipulation used to hide malicious file creation times.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=2
| eval time_diff=abs(CreationUtcTime-PreviousCreationUtcTime)
| where time_diff > 86400
| stats count by TargetFilename, Image, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Process Masquerading
library.description: Detect processes running from unexpected locations or with misleading names.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| eval suspicious=case(
    like(Image, "%\svchost.exe") AND NOT like(Image, "%\System32\%"), "svchost outside System32",
    like(Image, "%\csrss.exe") AND NOT like(Image, "%\System32\%"), "csrss outside System32",
    like(Image, "%\lsass.exe") AND NOT like(Image, "%\System32\%"), "lsass outside System32",
    like(Image, "%\services.exe") AND NOT like(Image, "%\System32\%"), "services outside System32",
    true(), null())
| where isnotnull(suspicious)
| stats count by suspicious, Image, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: Indicator Removal - File Deletion
library.description: Detect mass deletion of files that may indicate evidence destruction.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=23
| bin _time span=5m
| stats count, dc(TargetFilename) as unique_files by user, host, _time
| where count > 50 OR unique_files > 20
| sort -count

library.title: Windows Event Log Tampering
library.description: Detect attempts to clear, disable, or tamper with Windows event logs.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*wevtutil*cl*" OR CommandLine="*Clear-EventLog*" OR CommandLine="*wevtutil*sl*/e:false*")
| stats count by user, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: AMSI Bypass Attempts
library.description: Detect attempts to bypass the Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI).
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search CommandLine="*AmsiScanBuffer*" OR CommandLine="*amsiInitFailed*" OR CommandLine="*AmsiUtils*" OR CommandLine="*amsi.dll*"
| stats count by user, CommandLine, ParentCommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: Alternate Data Stream Usage
library.description: Detect creation or execution of alternate data streams used to hide malware.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=15
| stats count by TargetFilename, Contents, host
| sort -count

library.title: Security Tool Process Termination
library.description: Detect attempts to kill security tool processes.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*taskkill*" OR CommandLine="*Stop-Process*")
| search (CommandLine="*MsMpEng*" OR CommandLine="*defender*" OR CommandLine="*carbon*" OR CommandLine="*crowd*" OR CommandLine="*sentinel*" OR CommandLine="*symantec*" OR CommandLine="*mcafee*")
| stats count by user, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: Parent PID Spoofing
library.description: Detect processes with suspicious parent process relationships indicating PPID spoofing.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| where ParentImage!=Image
| eval suspicious=case(
    ParentImage="C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe" AND NOT match(Image, "(?i)C:\\Windows\\"), "svchost spawning non-Windows process",
    ParentImage="C:\Windows\explorer.exe" AND match(Image, "(?i)powershell|cmd"), "Explorer spawning shell",
    true(), null())
| where isnotnull(suspicious) AND ParentCommandLine=""
| stats count by suspicious, ParentImage, Image, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: Kubernetes API Unauthorized Access
library.description: Detect unauthorized or anonymous access attempts to the Kubernetes API.
library.spl:
index=kubernetes sourcetype=kube:apiserver
| search responseStatus.code>=400 OR user.username="system:anonymous"
| stats count by user.username, verb, requestURI, responseStatus.code, sourceIPs{}
| sort -count

library.title: Privileged Container Creation
library.description: Detect creation of privileged containers that can access host resources.
library.spl:
index=kubernetes sourcetype=kube:apiserver verb=create
| spath input=requestObject output=privileged path=spec.containers{}.securityContext.privileged
| where privileged="true"
| stats count by user.username, objectRef.name, objectRef.namespace
| sort -count

library.title: Container Escape Indicators
library.description: Detect potential container escape attempts through suspicious mount paths or capabilities.
library.spl:
index=kubernetes sourcetype=kube:apiserver verb=create
| spath input=requestObject
| search "spec.volumes{}.hostPath.path"="/var/run/docker.sock" OR "spec.volumes{}.hostPath.path"="/" OR "spec.containers{}.securityContext.capabilities.add{}"="SYS_ADMIN"
| stats count by user.username, objectRef.name, objectRef.namespace
| sort -count

library.title: Kubectl Exec into Container
library.description: Monitor interactive shell sessions into containers which may indicate compromise.
library.spl:
index=kubernetes sourcetype=kube:apiserver verb=create
| search requestURI="*/exec*" OR requestURI="*/attach*"
| stats count by user.username, objectRef.name, objectRef.namespace, sourceIPs{}
| sort -count

library.title: Secrets Access Monitoring
library.description: Track access to Kubernetes secrets which may contain sensitive credentials.
library.spl:
index=kubernetes sourcetype=kube:apiserver objectRef.resource=secrets verb IN (get, list, watch)
| stats count, dc(objectRef.name) as unique_secrets by user.username, objectRef.namespace, verb
| where count > 10 OR unique_secrets > 5
| sort -count

library.title: Docker Socket Access
library.description: Detect processes accessing the Docker socket which could indicate container escape.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search CommandLine="*/var/run/docker.sock*" OR CommandLine="*docker.sock*"
| stats count by user, Image, CommandLine, host
| sort -count

library.title: New Container Image Deployed
library.description: Track deployment of new or unknown container images in the environment.
library.spl:
index=kubernetes sourcetype=kube:apiserver verb=create objectRef.resource=pods
| spath input=requestObject output=image path=spec.containers{}.image
| stats earliest(_time) as first_seen, count by image, objectRef.namespace
| where first_seen > relative_time(now(), "-24h")
| eval first_seen=strftime(first_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort first_seen

library.title: Pod Security Policy Violations
library.description: Detect attempts to create pods that violate security policies.
library.spl:
index=kubernetes sourcetype=kube:apiserver verb=create objectRef.resource=pods responseStatus.code>=400
| search responseStatus.message="*forbidden*" OR responseStatus.message="*denied*" OR responseStatus.message="*policy*"
| stats count by user.username, objectRef.namespace, responseStatus.message
| sort -count

library.title: Database Login Failures
library.description: Monitor failed database authentication attempts that may indicate brute force attacks.
library.spl:
index=database sourcetype IN ("oracle:audit", "mssql:audit", "mysql:audit")
| search action=LOGON_FAILED OR action=LOGIN_FAILED OR action="FAILED_LOGIN"
| stats count by user, src_ip, database_name
| where count > 5
| sort -count

library.title: Privileged Database Operations
library.description: Track usage of privileged database commands like GRANT, DROP, or ALTER.
library.spl:
index=database sourcetype IN ("oracle:audit", "mssql:audit", "mysql:audit")
| search query_type IN ("GRANT", "REVOKE", "DROP", "ALTER", "CREATE USER", "DROP USER", "TRUNCATE")
| stats count by user, query_type, database_name, query
| sort -count

library.title: Large Data Extraction
library.description: Detect queries returning unusually large result sets that may indicate data theft.
library.spl:
index=database sourcetype IN ("oracle:audit", "mssql:audit", "mysql:audit")
| where rows_returned > 10000 OR bytes_returned > 10000000
| stats sum(rows_returned) as total_rows, sum(bytes_returned) as total_bytes by user, database_name, src_ip
| sort -total_rows

library.title: After-Hours Database Access
library.description: Monitor database access occurring outside normal business hours.
library.spl:
index=database sourcetype IN ("oracle:audit", "mssql:audit", "mysql:audit") action=LOGON OR action=LOGIN
| eval hour=strftime(_time, "%H")
| where hour < 6 OR hour >= 20
| stats count by user, database_name, src_ip
| sort -count

library.title: Database Schema Changes
library.description: Track modifications to database schema including table and column changes.
library.spl:
index=database sourcetype IN ("oracle:audit", "mssql:audit", "mysql:audit")
| search query_type IN ("CREATE TABLE", "DROP TABLE", "ALTER TABLE", "CREATE INDEX", "DROP INDEX")
| stats count by user, query_type, object_name, database_name
| sort -count

library.title: Sensitive Table Access
library.description: Monitor access to tables containing sensitive data like PII or financial information.
library.spl:
index=database sourcetype IN ("oracle:audit", "mssql:audit", "mysql:audit")
| search object_name IN ("CUSTOMERS", "USERS", "EMPLOYEES", "CREDIT_CARDS", "PAYMENTS", "SSN", "PASSWORDS", "CREDENTIALS")
| stats count, dc(user) as unique_users by object_name, database_name
| sort -count

library.title: SQL Injection via Database Logs
library.description: Detect SQL injection patterns in database query logs.
library.spl:
index=database sourcetype IN ("oracle:audit", "mssql:audit", "mysql:audit")
| search query="*'*OR*'*" OR query="*UNION*SELECT*" OR query="*;*DROP*" OR query="*1=1*" OR query="*--*"
| stats count by user, query, src_ip
| sort -count

library.title: Database Backup Operations
library.description: Monitor database backup activities to ensure compliance and detect unauthorized backups.
library.spl:
index=database sourcetype IN ("oracle:audit", "mssql:audit", "mysql:audit")
| search query_type IN ("BACKUP", "EXPORT", "DUMP", "BACKUP DATABASE", "expdp", "mysqldump")
| stats count by user, query_type, database_name, dest_path
| sort -count

library.title: DCSync Attack Detection
library.description: Detect DCSync attacks by monitoring directory replication requests from non-DC sources.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4662
| search Properties="*Replicating Directory Changes*" OR Properties="*1131f6ad-9c07-11d1-f79f-00c04fc2dcd2*" OR Properties="*1131f6aa-9c07-11d1-f79f-00c04fc2dcd2*"
| lookup is_domain_controller host OUTPUT is_dc
| where is_dc!="true"
| stats count by SubjectUserName, SubjectDomainName, ObjectName, host
| sort -count

library.title: Kerberoasting Detection
library.description: Detect Kerberoasting attacks by monitoring TGS requests for service accounts.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4769 Ticket_Encryption_Type=0x17
| bin _time span=5m
| stats dc(ServiceName) as unique_spns, count as requests by Client_Address, _time
| where unique_spns > 5
| sort -unique_spns

library.title: AS-REP Roasting Detection
library.description: Detect AS-REP Roasting by monitoring pre-authentication disabled accounts.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4768 Pre_Authentication_Type=0
| stats count by Client_Address, user
| where count > 5
| sort -count

library.title: Group Policy Object Modification
library.description: Monitor changes to Group Policy Objects that could affect domain security.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=5136 ObjectClass=groupPolicyContainer
| stats count by SubjectUserName, ObjectDN, AttributeLDAPDisplayName, AttributeValue
| sort -count

library.title: LDAP Reconnaissance
library.description: Detect LDAP queries commonly used for Active Directory enumeration.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=1644
| search SearchFilter="*objectClass=*" OR SearchFilter="*samAccountType*" OR SearchFilter="*userAccountControl*"
| stats count, dc(SearchFilter) as unique_queries by Client_IP
| where count > 50 OR unique_queries > 10
| sort -count

library.title: AdminSDHolder Modification
library.description: Detect modifications to AdminSDHolder which can be used for AD persistence.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=5136
| search ObjectDN="*AdminSDHolder*"
| stats count by SubjectUserName, ObjectDN, AttributeLDAPDisplayName, AttributeValue
| sort -count

library.title: SID History Injection
library.description: Detect SID History modifications that could indicate privilege escalation.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4765 OR EventCode=4766
| stats count by SubjectUserName, TargetUserName, SidHistory
| sort -count

library.title: Domain Trust Modifications
library.description: Monitor creation or modification of domain trusts that could indicate compromise.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4706 OR EventCode=4707 OR EventCode=4716 OR EventCode=4865
| stats count by SubjectUserName, TrustDirection, TrustType, TrustedDomain
| sort -count

library.title: Ransomware Note File Creation
library.description: Detect creation of common ransomware note files indicating active encryption.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| search TargetFilename="*README*" OR TargetFilename="*DECRYPT*" OR TargetFilename="*RECOVER*" OR TargetFilename="*HOW_TO*" OR TargetFilename="*RESTORE*" OR TargetFilename="*.hta"
| bin _time span=5m
| stats count, dc(host) as affected_hosts by TargetFilename, _time
| where count > 5
| sort -count

library.title: Mass File Encryption Activity
library.description: Detect rapid file modifications with extension changes indicating ransomware encryption.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| bin _time span=1m
| stats count as file_changes, dc(TargetFilename) as unique_files by host, user, _time
| where file_changes > 100 AND unique_files > 50
| sort -file_changes

library.title: Volume Shadow Copy Deletion
library.description: Detect deletion of shadow copies, a key ransomware preparation step.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*vssadmin*delete*shadow*" OR CommandLine="*wmic*shadowcopy*delete*" OR CommandLine="*bcdedit*/set*recoveryenabled*no*" OR CommandLine="*wbadmin*delete*catalog*")
| stats count by host, user, CommandLine, ParentImage
| sort -count

library.title: Backup Destruction Commands
library.description: Detect commands targeting backup systems and recovery options.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*delete*backup*" OR CommandLine="*wbadmin*delete*" OR CommandLine="*recoveryenabled*No*" OR CommandLine="*bootstatuspolicy*ignoreallfailures*")
| stats count by host, user, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Ransomware Process Behavior
library.description: Detect processes exhibiting ransomware-like behavior patterns.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| join type=inner host [search index=sysmon EventCode=11 | bin _time span=5m | stats count as file_mods by host, Image | where file_mods > 100]
| join type=inner host [search index=sysmon EventCode=1 CommandLine="*vssadmin*" OR CommandLine="*shadow*"]
| stats count by host, Image, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Network Share Enumeration Before Encryption
library.description: Detect network share discovery that often precedes ransomware spread.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*net view*" OR CommandLine="*net share*" OR CommandLine="*Get-SmbShare*")
| bin _time span=10m
| stats count by host, user, _time
| where count > 3
| sort -count

library.title: Known Ransomware File Extensions
library.description: Detect files being renamed to known ransomware extensions.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| rex field=TargetFilename "\.(?<extension>[^\.]+)$"
| search extension IN ("encrypted", "locked", "crypto", "crypt", "enc", "locky", "cerber", "wcry", "wncry", "wncryt", "crinf", "r5a", "XRNT", "XTBL", "aaa", "abc", "xyz", "zzz", "micro", "xxx", "ttt", "mp3", "vvv", "ecc", "exx", "ezz")
| stats count by host, extension
| where count > 10
| sort -count

library.title: Ransomware Canary File Access
library.description: Detect access to honeypot/canary files placed to detect ransomware.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11 OR index=security EventCode=4663
| search TargetFilename="*canary*" OR TargetFilename="*honeypot*" OR ObjectName="*RANSOMWARE_DETECTION*"
| stats count by host, user, TargetFilename, Image
| sort -count

library.title: DNS Tunneling Detection
library.description: Detect DNS tunneling through unusually long queries or high query volumes.
library.spl:
index=dns
| eval query_length=len(query)
| eval subdomain_count=mvcount(split(query, "."))
| where query_length > 50 OR subdomain_count > 5
| stats count, avg(query_length) as avg_length by src_ip, query
| where count > 10
| sort -avg_length

library.title: HTTP Beaconing Pattern
library.description: Detect regular HTTP callbacks indicative of C2 beaconing.
library.spl:
index=proxy OR index=firewall
| bin _time span=1m
| stats count by src_ip, dest_ip, dest_port, _time
| streamstats current=f window=10 stdev(count) as stdev_count, avg(count) as avg_count by src_ip, dest_ip
| where stdev_count < 1 AND avg_count > 0
| stats count as beacon_minutes, avg(avg_count) as requests_per_min by src_ip, dest_ip, dest_port
| where beacon_minutes > 30
| sort -beacon_minutes

library.title: Domain Generation Algorithm (DGA)
library.description: Detect communication with DGA domains through entropy analysis.
library.spl:
index=dns
| rex field=query "(?<domain>[^.]+)\.[^.]+$"
| eval domain_length=len(domain)
| eval consonant_ratio=len(replace(domain, "[aeiouAEIOU0-9]", ""))/domain_length
| where domain_length > 10 AND consonant_ratio > 0.7
| stats count by query, src_ip
| where count > 5
| sort -count

library.title: HTTPS to Non-Standard Ports
library.description: Detect HTTPS/TLS traffic to non-standard ports often used by C2.
library.spl:
index=firewall OR index=proxy
| search (app=ssl OR app=https) dest_port!=443 dest_port!=8443
| stats count, dc(src_ip) as unique_sources by dest_ip, dest_port
| where count > 10
| sort -count

library.title: Long Connection Duration
library.description: Detect unusually long-lived connections that may indicate C2 channels.
library.spl:
index=firewall
| where duration > 3600
| stats count, avg(duration) as avg_duration, sum(bytes) as total_bytes by src_ip, dest_ip, dest_port
| eval avg_duration_hours=round(avg_duration/3600, 2)
| where avg_duration_hours > 1
| sort -avg_duration

library.title: Cobalt Strike Default Indicators
library.description: Detect default Cobalt Strike malleable C2 profile indicators.
library.spl:
index=proxy OR index=web
| search (uri="*/pixel*" OR uri="*/__utm.gif*" OR uri="*/submit.php*" OR uri="*/visit.js*" OR uri="*jquery*.js*" OR user_agent="*Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE*")
| stats count by src_ip, dest, uri, user_agent
| where count > 5
| sort -count

library.title: Cloud Service C2 Abuse
library.description: Detect abuse of legitimate cloud services for C2 communication.
library.spl:
index=proxy
| search (url="*pastebin.com*" OR url="*githubusercontent.com*" OR url="*discord.com/api*" OR url="*slack.com/api*" OR url="*telegram.org*" OR url="*notion.so*")
| bin _time span=1h
| stats count, dc(src_ip) as unique_sources by url, _time
| where count > 20
| sort -count

library.title: Encoded PowerShell Web Requests
library.description: Detect PowerShell making web requests with encoded commands, common in staged C2.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1 process_name="powershell.exe"
| search (CommandLine="*Net.WebClient*" OR CommandLine="*Invoke-WebRequest*" OR CommandLine="*Invoke-RestMethod*" OR CommandLine="*DownloadString*" OR CommandLine="*DownloadFile*")
| search (CommandLine="*-enc*" OR CommandLine="*-e *" OR CommandLine="*FromBase64*")
| stats count by host, user, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Exploitation of Public-Facing Application
library.description: Detect potential exploitation through web application error patterns.
library.spl:
index=web status=500
| bin _time span=5m
| stats count as errors, dc(uri) as unique_uris by src_ip, dest, _time
| where errors > 20 AND unique_uris > 5
| sort -errors

library.title: Suspicious Office Document Execution
library.description: Detect Office applications spawning suspicious child processes indicating macro exploitation.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search parent_process_name IN ("winword.exe", "excel.exe", "powerpnt.exe", "outlook.exe")
| search process_name IN ("cmd.exe", "powershell.exe", "wscript.exe", "cscript.exe", "mshta.exe", "regsvr32.exe", "rundll32.exe")
| stats count by parent_process_name, process_name, CommandLine, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Browser Exploitation Indicators
library.description: Detect browser processes spawning unusual child processes indicating drive-by compromise.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search parent_process_name IN ("chrome.exe", "firefox.exe", "iexplore.exe", "msedge.exe", "browser_broker.exe")
| search process_name IN ("cmd.exe", "powershell.exe", "wscript.exe", "cscript.exe", "mshta.exe", "regsvr32.exe")
| stats count by parent_process_name, process_name, CommandLine, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Valid Account Compromise Indicators
library.description: Detect valid account abuse through impossible travel or unusual access patterns.
library.spl:
index=security EventCode=4624
| iplocation src_ip
| streamstats current=f last(City) as prev_city, last(_time) as prev_time, last(src_ip) as prev_ip by user
| eval time_diff_hours=((_time-prev_time)/3600)
| where City!=prev_city AND time_diff_hours < 2 AND isnotnull(prev_city)
| stats count by user, prev_city, City, prev_ip, src_ip, time_diff_hours
| sort time_diff_hours

library.title: External Remote Services Abuse
library.description: Detect suspicious access to external remote services like VPN or RDP.
library.spl:
index=vpn OR index=security EventCode=4624 Logon_Type=10
| iplocation src_ip
| search Country!="United States"
| stats count, dc(Country) as unique_countries, values(Country) as countries by user, src_ip
| where unique_countries > 1 OR count > 10
| sort -count

library.title: Supply Chain Compromise - Unexpected Updates
library.description: Detect software updates from unusual sources or at unusual times.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (process_name="*update*" OR process_name="*setup*" OR process_name="*install*")
| search NOT (Image="*\Windows\*" OR Image="*\Program Files*\Microsoft*" OR Image="*\Program Files (x86)\*")
| eval hour=strftime(_time, "%H")
| where hour < 6 OR hour > 20
| stats count by Image, CommandLine, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Spearphishing Link Click
library.description: Detect users clicking links that lead to file downloads or suspicious sites.
library.spl:
index=proxy
| search (url="*download*" OR url="*.exe" OR url="*.zip" OR url="*.rar" OR url="*.js" OR url="*.hta")
| lookup email_links url OUTPUT email_subject, sender
| where isnotnull(email_subject)
| stats count by user, url, email_subject, sender
| sort -count

library.title: Hardware Addition Detection
library.description: Detect new hardware devices that could be used for initial access.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=6 OR index=security EventCode=6416
| search DeviceDescription="*USB*" OR DeviceDescription="*Removable*" OR DeviceDescription="*Network*"
| stats earliest(_time) as first_seen, count by DeviceDescription, host, user
| where first_seen > relative_time(now(), "-24h")
| eval first_seen=strftime(first_seen, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
| sort first_seen

library.title: Wiper Malware Indicators
library.description: Detect disk wiping utilities and destructive malware patterns.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*format*" AND CommandLine="*/y*") OR CommandLine="*dd*if=/dev/zero*" OR CommandLine="*cipher*/w*" OR CommandLine="*sdelete*" OR process_name IN ("diskpart.exe", "clean.exe")
| stats count by host, user, CommandLine, ParentImage
| sort -count

library.title: MBR/Boot Record Modification
library.description: Detect attempts to modify master boot record or boot configuration.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*bootrec*" OR CommandLine="*bcdedit*" OR CommandLine="*fixmbr*" OR CommandLine="*PhysicalDrive0*")
| stats count by host, user, CommandLine, ParentImage
| sort -count

library.title: Cryptomining Process Detection
library.description: Detect cryptocurrency mining processes consuming system resources.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*stratum+tcp*" OR CommandLine="*-o pool.*" OR CommandLine="*xmrig*" OR CommandLine="*minerd*" OR CommandLine="*cgminer*" OR CommandLine="*cpuminer*" OR CommandLine="*--donate-level*")
| stats count by host, user, Image, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Cryptomining Network Connections
library.description: Detect network connections to known cryptocurrency mining pools.
library.spl:
index=firewall OR index=proxy
| search (dest_port IN (3333, 4444, 5555, 7777, 8888, 9999, 14444, 14433) OR url="*pool.*" OR url="*mining.*" OR url="*xmr.*" OR url="*monero*" OR url="*nicehash*")
| stats count, sum(bytes) as total_bytes by src_ip, dest_ip, dest_port
| sort -count

library.title: Service Disruption - Mass Service Stop
library.description: Detect mass stopping of services that may indicate sabotage.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*net stop*" OR CommandLine="*Stop-Service*" OR CommandLine="*sc stop*")
| bin _time span=5m
| stats count, dc(CommandLine) as unique_services by host, user, _time
| where count > 5 OR unique_services > 3
| sort -count

library.title: Data Destruction Commands
library.description: Detect commands used to permanently destroy data.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*del /f /s /q*" OR CommandLine="*rm -rf*" OR CommandLine="*Remove-Item*-Recurse*-Force*" OR CommandLine="*format*" OR CommandLine="*cipher /w*")
| search (CommandLine="*C:\*" OR CommandLine="*D:\*" OR CommandLine="*/*")
| stats count by host, user, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Defacement Indicators
library.description: Detect modifications to web server content that may indicate defacement.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=11
| search (TargetFilename="*wwwroot*" OR TargetFilename="*htdocs*" OR TargetFilename="*public_html*" OR TargetFilename="*inetpub*")
| search (TargetFilename="*index.*" OR TargetFilename="*default.*" OR TargetFilename="*.html" OR TargetFilename="*.htm" OR TargetFilename="*.php")
| stats count by TargetFilename, Image, user, host
| sort -count

library.title: Firmware/BIOS Access Attempts
library.description: Detect attempts to access or modify system firmware.
library.spl:
index=sysmon EventCode=1
| search (CommandLine="*firmware*" OR CommandLine="*bios*" OR CommandLine="*uefi*" OR CommandLine="*fwupd*" OR process_name IN ("fwupdate.exe", "flashrom.exe", "afuwin.exe"))
| stats count by host, user, Image, CommandLine
| sort -count

library.title: Quick IOC Search
library.description: Search for a specific IP address, domain, or hash across all log sources. Replace the placeholder with your IOC.
library.spl:
index=* ("192.168.1.100" OR "suspicious-domain.com" OR "abc123hash")
| stats count by index, sourcetype, source
| sort -count

library.title: Events Around a Timestamp
library.description: Find all events within 5 minutes of a specific time. Useful when you know something happened at a particular moment.
library.spl:
index=* earliest="01/15/2024:14:30:00" latest="01/15/2024:14:35:00"
| stats count by index, sourcetype, host
| sort -count

library.title: Data Source Inventory
library.description: See what log sources you have available and how much data each contains. Essential for understanding your visibility.
library.spl:
| tstats count where index=* by index, sourcetype
| sort -count
| head 50

library.title: Firewall Blocked Connections
library.description: View all connections that were blocked by the firewall. Helps identify what threats are being stopped.
library.spl:
index=firewall action IN (blocked, denied, drop, reject)
| stats count by src_ip, dest_ip, dest_port, action
| sort -count
| head 50

library.title: Windows Service Failures
